Leaving every 20 minutes across the day the tour (which only runs sporadically throughout the year) gives you excellent knowledge about the place including taking you into various committee and lobby rooms that you can't visit if you don't have the tour. It takes about 1 hour, 45 minutes and the excellent lady that took us round was both informative and interesting, keeping our group of 14 or so engaged for the entire time. The history behind the building is fascinating as is the architecture, and the numerous sculptures, paintings and artwork.Would highly recommend!
Very interesting. Very interesting to see how it all works and we were suprised at the opulance and the fact it was small than it appears on tv. Well worth a visit.
Best tour . We LOVED our tour of Parliament. The kids had their own version of the tour and really interacted. It was so neat to see behind the scenes. Definitely something we would do again.
Amazing. This is a really worthwhile visit and gives you a completely different perspective on democracy and tradition. Best to book

Incredible!. We recently took the guided tour of the Houses of Parliament and found it quite incredible. From the moment you enter the Great Hall you realise that you are walking through history. Our guide was excellent and brought each area to life. We had no idea what to expect (apart from the areas seen on TV regularly) and were absolutely amazed at the architecture, design, artistry and opulence. An absolute must on a visit to London!

Amazing. My daughter bought the guided tour for my husband, Im glad she chose this option rather than walking round with headphones. Our guide, Jeff, was amazing, he was very informative. The whole tour lasted 1 hour 40 mins and i cant recommend it enough if you go to London. Im really not into politics but i felt quite emotional walking round learning about the history and those who have stepped foot in this beautiful building. Please be aware that there is a lot of standing around while listening to the guide and when you enter a room with seats/benches you are not always allowed to sit on them.

Wonderful audio tour, especially for those who love politics and government . My wife and I recently visited London and one of our first stops was a (audio) tour of Parliament. This was a perfect tour for people like us who are fascinated by workings of government and may not understand how system outside of the United States work. The audio guide features British politicians that explain the role of each chamber in forging legislation. Additionally the guide does a great job of explains the rich history of parliament and the importance of various rooms. We very much enjoyed this tour and recommend it for visitors to London!
Tourist attraction. Westminster is a hotspot for tourists so be prepared for lots of people to be around. The architecture is beautiful. Definitely worth a visit
Stunning Architecture. Thought when you are not a citizen you cant visit it but apperantely you can reserve your place for an afternoon tea get a guided or audio tour.
No Politics!. Great looking building! Fit right in with the area. We walked and drove by it. It's right down there by Big Ben so you can't miss it when visiting the aqrea.

Definitely a must see when in London. In addition to the Tower of London, The Houses of Parliament along with Big Ben are a definitely must see while visiting London. A trip to London should not be without at least a tour.

Passionate tourist guide. I have never enjoyed anything like that. Our guide talked in very passionate and compelling way. The tour showed the inside secrets of the Palace of Westminster in the really interesting way. I am already planning my next visit because it something it´s worth to repeat.

Lots of interesting history and traditions. Visited with the local youth council during the Easter holidays. It was very easy to get to the building, but finding the entrance wasn't the clearest, although this is understandable, as it is a very high security building. Once inside, it was very easy to work out where we needed to be. All the tours seemed to be running on time, so our tour started at the time that we expected. A very efficient process.We were shown around and told about the history of the building by our tour guide, Peter Clark. He was very knowledgeable about the building and British politics. Any questions that were asked, he knew the answer to. He also had a great sense of humour and appeared to be great with the younger children.Overall, it was an amazing visit and I would suggest it to anyone who is able to gain entry. The best way is contacting your local MP, who may be able to give you tickets free of charge.

HP with plenty of sauce..... We had chosen 3 attractions to visit on our weekend trip to London of which the Houses of Parliament was the top of the list, as my Granddaughter had wished to see the seat of democracy as she wishes to enter local politics as a future career. We booked a tour guided visit which give us the full taste of this lovely place. Our tour guide had excellent knowledge of the history of this place and all its protocol(s), do's and don'ts etc....We had the full works on this visit as it was the Easter recess and we had been able to get into each of the Lords and Commons chambers, as well as seeing the Royal robing room and other areas not accessible whilst parliament is in session also some of the meeting rooms where normal day to day business is held. It was a joy to see my Granddaughter actually standing next to the Commons despatch boxes in the debating chamber with all its microphones around and some of the stories about how seating is arranged as even the PM doesn't actually have a specific seat assigned to him, I believe unless you go to prayers you cannot have a seat assigned. Wonderful, breathtaking and most enjoyable albeit that we spent almost 2 hours on this visit. I thoroughly recommend a guided tour when Parliament is in recess.
Great sight. I was not able to go inside for a visit but it is a beautiful building! The big ben is awesome and the Westminster Abbey is near by.This part of London must be visited.

Fascinating history. A worthwhile visit to the home of parliament during the Easter recess.Whilst having to pay an entry fee( you can visit for free whilst parliament is sitting), this visit enabled access to the actual chambers of both houses giving a unique perspective of standing at the dispatch box, as well as seeing the Royal robing room and other areas not accessible whilst parliament is in session.The visitor assistants are friendly and provide a wealth of information to those who ask.

Watch a debate in the House of Lords. Went with a group of law students to sit in on a debate in the House of Lords. Were shown around by Baroness Suttie with some questions and answers about the workings of the HL. JUST in time before the Palace of Westminster will shut for at least four years. Recommend to go asap.

Fantastic experience and afternoon tea is delightful. Booked on the guided tour of the Houses of Parliament and it was brilliant so informative and interesting. The building inside is so impressive and it is great to see. Staff from security to the guide were so friendly and professional. Afternoon tea was a delight, amazing food, service was first class. Overall the tour and afternoon tea are a must and great value for money.
The Upper House!. By the banks of THAMES, A beautiful architecture landmark in the city !! Must a visit can't be missed!
Really Interesting. This was a really interesting experience for us. We loved going to the house of lords chamber and the house of commons chamber.
very good tour, and informative. allways wanted to do tour of here, and was not disappointed, steeped in history, and very informative tour, would recommend
breathtaking. Definitely the highlight of our stay in London! We chose the guided tour and we had the best guide. Ask for Isabel, she's excellent.

Brilliant, really really good.. Took the audio tour, excellent recording and we were surprised how entertaining and interesting it was. the best part was actually going into The House of Lords chamber ( amazingly beautiful) and the House of Commons Chamber. The news will never been the same!

A Riveting History Lesson. A tour (free to uk citizens if arranged via your MP) lasting approx 90 mins kept my family entertained for the whole time - our enthusiastic guide took great effort to engage us and include my 11 year old twins. An opportunity to find out the history of the Houses of Westminster and see it working day to day. You do not visit the House of Commons on a Wednesday due to Prime Ministers question times - however you can arrange tickets for the public viewing area (again via your MP). Foreign visitors can arrange a tour which is reasonably priced. There are some steep steps at the beginning and the tour does go at a fair pace which may be worth bearing in mind if you have mobility issues.
you mustn't miss the Houses of Parliament. on your tours.... everybody should have the experience of visiting the Houses of Parliament is where it all happens

A UK Icon. During our weekend in London, the kids had a number of things on their tick-list, and this was one, the Houses of Parliament, we had a great walk from Buckingham Palace up-to the Houses of Parliament, and then a look back from London Bridge and then the Eye. They definitely enjoyed seeing something that they are so used to seeing on TV.

Take the tour, its worth the money. Either book in advance with your local MP for free (6 months) or pay the £25. Either way its worth the trip. This is a fantastic building, full of amazing portraits of monarchs and ministers from the past. I am no royalist, but history is always so fascinating in such spectacular surroundings.

Great experience. Family visit, including 2 teenage sons. Took the audio tour and found the whole visit absolutely fascinating. The architecture and history were equally impressive. Even my lads enjoyed it!!

another symbol of London. seeing Big Ben equals to seeing the House of Parliament which forms an entity ; very strict security measures are applied at the House of Parliament so it is only possible to see it from outside and from the other side of the catwalk as there is Police everywhere and security measures are indeed outstanding ! I cannot precisely tell about the architectural style of the building but it makes a strong impression and leaves the impression of an architectural masterpiece with everything made to the finest detail ;it is like an architectural jewelry !
Very interesting . We had the lords tour. Very interesting to experience the bustle and to have a peek behind the scenes , a great experience.

I had been wanting to visit here for years....not dissapointed at all!. If you are fortunate enough to be shown around by Tim Hudson...that's a bonus in itself!! An extremely knowledgeable man with a great sense of humour and a presence that fits so well with these surroundings!Our tour was 90 minutes I chose to have the guided personalised tour which took us through from the House of Lords to the Commons. It was fantastic to see what we have all seen so many time on TV. To stand in front of the dispatch box, looking around at all those seats where our history has been seated....amazing!We had a retired persons deal and the £20 each was more than worth it. The building is undergoing upgrade works at present and judging by the general state of our 'Palace of Westminster' it will be ongoing for a number of years.When we booked on line we opted not to take afternoon tea on the terrace but regret it now as....how many times will one experience this day out!Thanks again Tim for a mind boggling knowledge intake.

A great combination of culture, politics, history and architecture. Went on the audio tour of the houses of parliament, which was a little expensive at £18 each, but very informative. The tour was easy to follow with each section clearly numbered as you walk through.The building itself is wonderful, the main hall being a 1000 years old and the various newer build chambers (following historical fires) are all well kept, in excellent condition. The highlight for me being the lords and common chambers, which are a lot smaller than they look on TV but you can still feel the import and weight of history around the place.The audio tour provided many fascinating bits of information on the construction, reconstruction of the building down the centuries, famous events to have taken place and the development of democracy and constitution in Britain.Highly recommended

An absolutely fantastic experience, well worth a visit. Booked in to visit Parliament over the Easter break on the advice of a friend who had been previously. Decided on an audio tour as it was our first visit. The security required is reassuring, yet not intrusive.The visit itself is one of the finest historic building visits I have ever yet to experience. The history of the building simply oozes out and you feel that you are in the presence of many of the greats of British politics over the centuries. We will definitely visit again when next in London, and will go with a guided tour, as those we overheard on tours, had very knowledgeable guides, who could share their knowledge of the history of this magnificent building
Iconic building. An iconic building with so much history. Beautiful architecturally and the best spot for both daytime and nighttime photos is Westminster Bridge.
Great to see. I wasn't inside but it is beautiful to look at. All the details! It is also worth to go there by day and night if you have time

Worth the Visit!. Definitely worth visiting! It's a great scenic portion of the city and on a nice sunny day be sure to pack a lunch. We ended up fining a nice area on the opposite side of the house of Parliament to have a picnic!
Amazing. Visited in August 2012 not 15, this is such a lovely building that has so much history. One day I will go back and see if they do a tour.

Beautiful building!. Houses of Parliament is a beautiful building however the trips are time restricted to however long the tour is but that's expected due to security and the amount of people that wish to visit! Would recommend a visit.

Another great British institution. This is a great building, not only to see where MP's and Lords are sitting, but the paintings and the history that goes with it makes it very interesting to walk around

Fantastic Visit. This had been on my do list for years. It was so much better than expected. We booked directly online including afternoon tea. It is best to go when parliament is in recess.We were warned that the queue for security could be up to half an hour but we went straight through.We did the group tour and Phillip the guide was brilliant. He talked for an hour and forty minutes and it was fascinating. The afternoon tea on the terrace was also very good.The whole thing was good value.I also thought that the £5 Official Guide from the shop was really worth buying to take home.

Self guided head phone tour. We try to do something each time we visit London and this time I picked the Houses of Parliament. Very interesting. You follow a map through Westminster and St Stephens Halls, both chambers, the division lobbies, robing room. Takes about 1 and a half hours and more if you want to listen to the supplementary info. £18.50 per adult and one free child per paying adult. Airport style security so a bit of a queue to be checked. There is a pleasant tea room at the end and a shop. Worth going to.

WHAT A PITY I COULD NOT VISIT IT.... Known as the Palace of Westminster, I had been recommended visiting it, I had read about it on the Internet, I had seek information about it in London guides, ... but when my parents and I decided our visit, there was neither a guided tour nor an audio tour between 1 and 4pm. So, I strongly recommend (and that will be the option I will take on my future London trip) booking your choice in advance in order to go in and discover its awesome halls and rooms and learn about its past.Moreover, its views from the Westminster Bridge or from the London Eye are spectacular... It is a fabulous building and it reminds me to the Hungarian Parlament Building, because of its location and structure.

Sense of History. Although the current building is not that old because it was restored in the 19th century in the Gothic style it has a historical feel to the building once you are inside. There are impressive staircases, wood panels and reception areas with high ceilings which lends a sense of importance to the building. Security is tight so expect to queue for 10-15 minutes before you are checked which scanners etc. and eventually given a visitors badge for use while you are in the building. I was attending a meeting with my member of parliament in a committee room and found the security staff very helpful with directing me to the correct area for my meeting. At quieter times it is possible to go into the visitors gallery and watch proceedings on the floor of the House of Commons but at busy time such as Prime Minister's Question Time the gallery is always full. My visit was free but it is possibly to buy a guided tour to this facility.

Great tour. Been to London many times, but had never done the Westminster Tour. It's well worth doing. We had the cutest older English lady give us the tour. Best ever. A few tips: 1-- Get your tickets online ahead of time.2-- Show up well in advance of your tour time. The security lines are thorough and slow. Allow a minimum of 30 minutes to get in. 3--Get the in person tour (as opposed to the audio guide). The guides take you places you can't go with the audio guide alone. 4--Go in the a.m. You can't sit anywhere, so you want your legs fresh so you can stand for 2 hours.
Great view. Nice location. Heritage building. A visit is must if you are in London. The vicinity is awesome. Looks amazing from the top of London Eye.

Interesting and Informative, but expensive. Around 90 minutes for a guided tour at £25 per person was a little on the expensive side. I know we are paying for the upkeep of the building and staff but i didn't realise that I was paying towards the MPs salaries/expenses as well!The tour took in all the sections of the Lords and Commons as well as the robing rooms and the artwork. It was very interesting in itself although the noise from the restoration of the floor made it sometimes difficult to hear what was being said.You are not allowed to take pictures except in 2 areas, and you are not allowed to sit on the seats of Lords/Commons at all. It is a shame as the houses were in recess and as such there was an ability to actually get into these areas.I would recommend that a self guided tour using audio would be better for most individuals to take advantage of a longer time to review and view.Booking is essential for his tour though

Beautiful Palace. Open for touring when Parliament is not in session, this incredible former palace houses treasures beyond measure! A great hall from the time of Henry the VIII takes your breath away. Fun to actually sit in the red and green velvet seats of the House of Lords and the House of Commons. When Parliament is in session, one can gain entrance to sit in the galleries and observe the goings on. Ticketing for the Houses of Parliament/Palace of Westminster can be found around the corner after exiting Westminster tube station, on the street parallel to Westminster Pier.
Magnificent. Awe inspiring. Walking by this building invoked a sense of awe and amazement. It looks magnificentad a seat of government should.
A must. If you are in London don't miss out on seeing Westminster. The architecture is stunning and it is an iconic building in London.

Amazing tour!. I visited Houses of Parliament with my partner just before Easter and we took audio guide. It was very interesting and the stories were of perfect length and not boring at all. I heard many interesting facts about Westminster Parliament and enjoyed it all. The architectural value of the palace is also priceless and I was stunned how beautiful it is. It is nice that we have a possibility to visit houses were our democracy happens. Definitely must visit location in London!

Beautiful Architecture. Just walking past these beautiful structures gives you a feeling of safety and security. Plan to spend some time gazing at the beautiful and intricate architecture ... and keep you hand on your wallet/pocketbook, the area is reputed to be filled with pickpockets.

Extraordinary tour. Booking in advance a must! Our guide was thoroughly informed and provided a marvelous understanding of the government of England. The room featuring Henry the 8th, wives and courtiers was incredible. Loved it!

No fireworks. If you go here for some wicked deep house fused with Parliament (George Clinton) you will be frustrated. It is mainly just posh men and a few ladies with bags and suits and people protesting about some things. Music is a low roar.
Key London Site. Key site to visit when in London - so much history of the site and surrounding area / landmarks. Best photos from across the river.

Great tour. Having read on Trip Adviser you can arrange a free visit by contacting your MP we decided to give it a go. This was easily arranged and well worth the effort we were met by a member of staff for the MP. The tour was very interesting and full of facts which you would not get via the audio tour. Our tour lasted two hours and we had a full tour of the house of commons and Lords. I cannot highlight enough how enjoyable this visit was not only for myself, wife and children. If you want to visit then this is the best way to do it.

Worth seeing if in London. Unless you have an interest in English Politics, Architecture, or UK culture then the houses of parliament tour could be avoided. A visit to the building itself for a look at it is definately worth the walk though, and its easy enough to fit in if you are planning to see big ben and westminster abbey due to all 3 being in fairly close proximity.

Big Easy Eat's tour of Whitehall . Went on the tour of Westminster and being a history nut I loved every minute of it. It has such rich history and the guide told us lots of interesting stories ranging from the French presidents address to the British stood in front of the huge pictures depicting Waterloo to the American business tycoon hidden in one of the pictures in return for paying money towards parliament. I have toured other government buildings such as The United States Capitol building in Washington and i have to say this tour beat it hands down. Well worth a trip to this historical building which has been key to shaping the world as we know it.

View from across the River Thames. The view is definitely more enjoyable far from the tourists. Take the walk through the Westminster bridge for a better view. For free, you can watch the inside by putting your camera through the gates.

Excellent school trip . I've been twice, as a teacher, on a school trip and they certainly know how to put on an informative experience for teenagers. Coupled with impressive architecture architecture and a solid knowledge of constitutional history by the guides and you're in for a treat!
Jaw dropping . Look closely at this beautiful building , it's insane! I work opposite at the hospital and never bore of this view . Gorgeous and a must see for tourists !!!!

Excellent tour - queue a bit of a shock!. First of all, if you pre-book timed tickets you should still be prepared to queue for quite a long time to get in, which we hadn't expected. We politely queried this and were told we should have been advised to arrive at least half an hour ahead of the time of our tour but we definitely weren't. So the guided tour we got was about 40 minutes later than the one we'd booked - but still worth every penny! It was so interesting and our guide was so informative, making all the details he gave us really interesting. I would definitely recommend paying the little bit extra for a guided tour rather than the audio tour - we went into a couple of rooms others couldn't access and could ask lots of questions as we went along. It took a bit longer than the advertised hour and a half and was certainly worth the wait.

Amazing. Wonderful intricate architecture, so much history and overlooking the river Thames. Must be one of the top visited landmarks in the world! Beautiful in the evening as it is fully lit up and can be seen for quite a distance.

Great snapshot of UK politics. Pre booked to visit on Easter weekend. Was thoroughly impressed from start to finish. Our tour guide took us through the whole of the building whilst explaining in some details the history behind each room (including the commons and the Lords). Really interesting tour. Worth the £25
Lunch with a working peer, and a look round. Exciting to be on the inside, lots of famous faces just getting on with their work. Steeped in history, would recommend any tour
Houses of Parliament and House of Lords. Loved it....... Well worth having a visit But book your tickets before hand if you want to go straight in

A very good and interesting tour. This tour is rather exceptional. Only possible on a Saturday. There were a lot of people taking different tours, however each group is pleasantly small in numbers. The guide was excellent. You are informed to arrive early due to security checks, however the cafe is not open till 10 o'clock, so getting there one hour before the 10 o'clock tour was a very cold and boring experience. I am sure they could make more money by opening the cafe and the shop earlier.

Amazing architecture . Guess the same architect who designed st paul cathedral. ..Just in front ...of the west minister abbey....London bridge...London Eye and other attractionsAlso called the big benGet down at the west minister station

Insight into UK politics past and present. Did a return visit to Parliament, 10 years after the previous time - had forgotten how much there is to see and learn! It's a great insight into UK politics past and present, with excellent tour guides - engaging and knowledgeable. Amazing to see how much smaller the Commons chamber is than it how it looks on TV! The building is spectacular, especially in and around the House of Lords; also clear to see where the old building needs some renovation!Visited during the September recess - still very popular so book ahead and allow plenty of time to get through security.

Educational trip. well organised and brilliant tour guides. They brought the building to life. Sadly we didn't get to watch any debates, but instead we got to see the speakers procession through the lobby. It was fantastic to witness, even if my son was put out by them calling everyone "strangers" but that became a lesson in itself!
Top view. Beautiful view. Great area to walk around. Follow the arrows, don' t look at your phone, just discover historic London.

Fabulous....... Booked in advance for the guided tour. Good value at £25 each as guide was well informed and interesting. Listening to other guides (which we could do some of the time as it was a busy Easter Saturday) made it clear that some guides concentrate on different bits to others but that just means another visit might be worthwhile. Booking in advance is a must and do get there early to get through the airport style security (a pity it's needed but vital these days). We started to queue 30 mins before our tour start time and just as well we did. Overall a fascinating introduction to a fascinating part of our history.

Superb (Book through your MP!!!!). Really, really interesting visit and the guides were helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.If attending during recess (as we did), you get to visit all parts of the palace - surprising how small the chambers are.Great for anyone with a passing interest in politics or history.Book via your MP (we contacted ours via his website). The wait can be up to 6 months - but it is free if you do it this way!!!

Quite good.. I wouldn't say it was brilliant, as the staff were a bit rude, and you didn't know where to go to get the headsets, there was no clear instructions to the entrance of parliament. The inside is amazing, even though you could only take pictures in 2 rooms, it was still breath taking to see how beautiful parliament actually is.

Don't miss this.. Visited Houses of Parliament on Saturday 19 March. We prebooked the audio tour so you can go at your own pace, stop and browse, or go back over areas. Fantastic afternoon spent absorbing the history and the architecture. The House of Commons is not as big in reality as it looks on TV. A must see next time you visit London.
The mother of parliaments. The building dates from the 19th century and it was rebuilt after the war as the commons was destroyed.Now facing further challenges as a result of creeping decay.
A must see. A highlight on any tourist trip to London and if you get your timing right, you can go on one of the excellent tours of the building.
Beautiful architecture!. We finally got to see this structure at night. We had pictures of it during the day but I wanted to see it all lit up. We went out specifically to get some night time shots.

Britannia Rules. Just consider that for over two hundred years, this building was the seat of power for over two thirds of the world. The well crafted statues which look upon the Parliament house are of those masters who were Prime Ministers and Generals, people who changed the fortunes of the world with a nod of their heads.The British Parliament house remains an impressive and awe inspiring piece of history.

Tour and PMQs. We applied via our local MP for tickets to watch Prime Ministers Questions. His secretary was really helpful and not only arranged this for us but also booked us in for a tour.I was unprepared for how blown away we were by the outstanding beauty and history involved in touring this Iconic building.The tour guide, Mick was excellent and gave us a real insight to the history of Parliament through the years. Prime minister questions was thoroughly enjoyable.I can not recommend highly enough and would encourage everyone to take the opportunity to visit here.

Excellent tour. Informative visit aranged by our MP - managed to see the House of Commons, house of Lords, the Queen's Robing Room as well the other attractions; lhad coffee on the terrace and saw his private office.

A London must!. Quite simply the most important place to visit in London.Our visit was quite special as we received a personal tour by the staff of our local MP who really brought the tour alive for the kids...and me!There's a good chance to see some MP's even if Parliament isn't in session.
very historical building. This unique building was excellence and their art work is ccool. Hard to see this kind of architecture that still protected in a good conditions.
On the Thames. Visit the area in the morning from the far side of the river to shoot these iconic buildings in the best light. London Eye is a good vantage point.

Amazing Experience!. This is such an amazing experience. The ins and outs of one of the oldest parliaments in the world. The guided tour is in different languages. Everyone one must visit if touring London, UK.

See where it all happens. Went on the tour with a guide and she was excellent and she was so friendly to the four young kids in our group (under 10 years). Would recommend the guided tour (even though it si more expensive) as you can ask questions and go at your own pace. We did over run a bit but that was our fault. Recommended!!!!

Dinner... Strangers dining room....excellent food, good choice and decent waiting staff. Was expecting a plate though rather than a chopping board...!
Strangers bar a nice venue too.

a real privilege. Booked on the family suffragette tour with my 2 children aged 12 and 13. The tickets clearly stated what we were there for yet we found ourselves on the blue badge tour. I didn't realise this for ages, I think we were so blown away by the splendour of the house of Lords, only when I saw a group of children go by on the tour we should have been on. I spoke up and was immediately looked after by a steward. Too late to join our tour he found a guide to come and give us a private tour of the house of commons and tell us about the suffragettes. It felt really special, we learnt loads, the children loved it, they knew this was a rare opportunity. I was impressed how much the staff cared and wanted to rectify things for us. We were enjoying the blue badge tour but it wasn't what we had booked. I've lived in London for years and never knew it was possible to even go inside the houses of parliament, I still wouldn't if I hadn't seen this special suffragette season advertised. I was amazed to see so many people inside, mostly doing audio tours but also guided tours in several languages.

See your MP at work. I applied in good time for a ticket for Prime Minister's Questions, always an interesting event, and I had the added bonus of being there on Budget Day. Get there early so that you have plenty of time to go through the necessarily strict security checks. You'll then have time to take in the amazing architecture and decorations before seeing the Speaker's procession which marks the start of the day's proceedings.

Find out about our heritage. We were on a private tour and our guide tried to point out the specific design features. For an old building, you'll never believe how young some areas are! There's lots of stories to hear, many that form the foundations of British society. My favourites are the suffragist who was resident for the 1911 census and the scratch marks made by the Horseguards. If you're really lucky and visiting in a group you can organise a private room for afternoon tea. Fabulous food and service in a very unique setting.

Spur of the moment visit. The HoP is a great visit. We were in London for the weekend and bought tickets on a spur of the moment visit. We did the audio tour and I would recommend this as you can go at you r own pace. We took around two hours. The rooms are fascinating and the history immersive. highly recommended.

British institution. It's one of those places that is an absolutely Must See. If there's one place in London you go, then visit Westminster and simply rove around and take in the superb architecture, the design, the style. Stunning. Then go inside and explore. This place is an institution.
A Must place to visit. This place is steeped in history so if you love politics or history then this is the place to go. There are escorted tours.
What history. Booked a tour online of the area open to the public. Extremely knowledgable & fun guide. Learned so much of Britain's history and architecture of the building. Another must see and do.

Best photos from south of Westminster Bridge on east side of Thames. It's a classic and picturesque building, so be sure to get your keepsake picture! Very good photos can be taken from just south of the Westminster bridge on the east side of the Thames. The viewpoint lets you get most or all of the Houses of Parliament in your shot.
An icon. We were able to see the houses of parliament from outside, and took many pictures. It's amazing how intricate the details are!
Good use of 90 minutes. Took the Audio Tour. Very worthwhile moving at your own pace. We managed to get into most of the important area's within Parliament. Very interesting audio throughout

Beautiful place to really indulge in history. I visited the Houses of Parliament las Friday and all I can say is WOW! The tour guide was amazing, she knew all there was to know and more about the place. It's a real treat for history/politics enthusiasts. Maybe not the best place to take teenagers. My group didn't really appreciate what they were seeing or learning. I however DID!This place is beautiful, steeped in history and makes you proud to be British.
Another must. Everyone who is somewhat interested in politics should visit the parliament. Great tossed how different democratic systems are
Awesome Architecture. Didn't go inside but had time allowed it would've been cool to sit in on Parliament meeting. Really close to Big Ben and other attractions so why not see it!

Guide Visit. Visited to get presented with Guide Honors - Private room with Canapes during the visitManaged to have a look round the vast historical landmarkNo time at all through security which was good as we were told it could take 30 minutes

Always a different Tour. This is a great tour (book online) and every time one goes (I've been five times), it is a bit different, depending on what is happening in the building and who your tour guide is for the excursion. The Great Hall with its amazing roof is worth the price of the tour.

Worth a visit. Was hesitant about visiting because politics not usually my thing but I had a great time. The interior decor is a feast for the eyes - typical Pugin. The audio tour is well organised with lots of interesting information with sufficient details regarding the history of the rooms/buildings to enable a good understanding without being boring.

Women's suffrage tour. We signed up for the "Women's suffrage tour" before arriving in London and it was one of the first things we did. We had an excellent guide and the tour was one of the most informative that we had during our visit. Fascinating stuff is all I can say.

Wow what an amazing place. If your in London go see Houses of Parliament, The architecture is totally amazing, the history with in this building goes back for ever, beautiful place to see , we spend hrs walking around this building, you can also buy tickets to go inside which in itself is cool , definate place to vist

This is London. If you want to say that you have been in London you must come to this place. It's not just Big Ben but the whole parliament that is just beautiful. This is the place that anyone in the world knows of London from school books, pictures and TV.

self-guided audio tour - informative and eye-opening. I was very impressed with the dept of history this short tour covers and also with the access to some of the key rooms in current parliament. I thought we'd be viewing the Commons through a window rather than walking through them. Fascinating. If you listen to all the explanations, allow 2 1/2 hours. Also the first chamber is very cold so wrap up warm as you'll spend around 20 minutes there
Seat of Parliment. Nothing like it in the world, what a place to visit, so interesting and the history is fantastic, what a building something to look at everywhere. Go you will not be disappointed

Free visit to Parliament Gallery!!. Anyone can go and hear the debate in Parliament if the Pariamentarians are inside. It's completely free & the wonderful thing is the security is not asking to show our Identity Card or anything to go inside the Parliament!!

Mother of Parliaments. You cannot be but overwhelmed by a visit to the Houses of Parliament and should be something that's top of your list when visiting London. The structure of the building is to be looked at in awe although remedial work is currently being undertaken in the main lobby. Conducted visits can be taken at a cost but you could always have your MP to invite you.
Excellent. Great as always. The houses of parliament together with their bell-tower the Big Ben is just an iconic sight in London. Also great in the evening/at night.

Amazing - took us by surprise!. A relative reccommended this tour to us, as they had visited with a school. We booked online and selected to have a tour guide rather than the audio guide. We thought it was rather pricey at £25 per person. However, we feel that we got great value for money. Security checks on the way in were strict but the staff were friendly (and humerous in some cases) and it didn't take too long to pass through.The tour was really informative both politically and historically, We were able to go into the House of Commons, House of Lords and the Queens robing room, amongst many others. The tour guide was able to answer the questions and relaly personalised the tour to our group. We had a snack in the cafe which was reasonably priced considering the location and bought some souvineers in the shop.

A highlight. After a tour of Queen Elizabeth Tower the guide took us to the Great Hall and then said that we could visit the lobby. On our way there we were stopped and a man thrust green tickets into our hands before we knew it we were in the Public Gallery watching a debate in the House of Commons. It was fascinating as much more goes on than you see on TV.A few years ago we did the tour of the Houses of Parliament which we enjoyed very much but is was great to return to see the house sitting.The house was not too busy and some of the MPs that were there sprawled about, some were texting and some were passing their phones to others to read. People were coming and going.All very interesting.After we visited the gift shop though there is a shop outside the grounds selling the same things.

Chance encounter. Walking past Parliament, noticed officials at an entrance. They informed us that the Speaker's Gallery was open as a debate was in progress. Haven't been before so went in and following directions entered the great hall where the Royals and the greats have been laid in state, plaques in the floor give names and dates. There is security and bags must be left at staffed cloakroom. Staff are very helpful giving information. Afterwards we visited the gift shop and cafe for scone and drink. An enjoyable, and different, way to spend a morning.

Amazing Architecture. Just go stare at how beautiful and detailed this building is! There are certain places you have to see in person while visiting big cities. You don't go to NYC and not see the Empire State or Lady Liberty. You don't go to London and not see Big Ben and Parliament.
Great look at living history. I did the tour of the Houses of Parliament and would very much recommend this to anyone interested in the workings on the UK Parliament
Excellent!. I have just reviewed this on Big Ben, Really interesting, the architecture and the history attached. Our Guide (Olivia I think) was very interesting. Well worth a visit

An Historial place, worth the visit .. I was fortunate enough to have had an invitation to visit the Houses of Parliament outside the normal times, and the tour and history was breathtaking, as well as most interesting. When one considers the age of this building , which is steeped in history, it certainly worth a visit. Security is very tight, and no photographs are allowed. You can sit in the gallery to listen to the political parties interacting.

Amazing architecture and alot of history. Amazing building with alot of history behind it, just a shame its been pretty much full of corrupt bureaucrats since it was constructed. Defiantly worth looking around at least once.

Extremely interesting visit - with lovely afternoon tea!. We were given a tour of Houses of Parliament and afternoon tea for Christmas. We had a lovely time. So interesting to visit and learn about the special places.

Great experience for free. What an amazing place to visit. The amount of history under one roof is fantastic. I only wish the tour was longer than the 75 mins given. There is so much to take in. The houses of lords and commons are much smaller than you see on the TV. I might have to go back again to take more in.

Fascinating insight. Audio tours are available on Saturdays for timed entry. Buy tickets from the building adjacent to the Palace of Westminster just before you go over Westminster Bridge. Security is tight ( think airport style) as you would expect so you need to arrive about 20 minutes before your allocated tour time. Tours are available in several languages - and delivered via headset. You get an opportunity to see the Great Hall, Public Lobby, House of Lords, House of Commons and some of the smaller side galleries. The audio is comprehensive and although the recommended tour time is 1-11/2 hours, we were there for 21/2 hours just listening to the commentary and admiring the architecture. If you have an interest in UK politics then this is definitely a tour for you. Even if the antics of the MP's and Lords are not your thing, the buildings themselves are fascinating with many historical interesting facts.
Very interesting. This was my son's choice. It was a very interesting tour and great insight into how parliament works. It was extremely informative and even kept him engaged.

Tea on the terrace. After a fascinating tour we were delighted with tea on the terraceSuperb selection of sandwiches, warm scones and2 types of jam, cakes and the ultimate millionaire 's shortbread. A delicious spread!

Just visit. I went to visit the outside and have a view on the atmosphere all around.A lot to visit and learn about Britain. Photos souvenir were every one interest.I was amazed to see a just married couple and family having their photos taken.The architecture is phenomenal with lots of art design to observe.

An educational trip around the seat of power. This was an educational trip organised around Parliament for children aged 12-14. The tour was well organised, the guides being very knowledgeable about the inner workings of Parliament and it's history and were very enthusiastic about the pomp and ceremony that took place and happy to answer all the questions fielded by the adults and children. Afterwards, the workshop they put on engaged most of the children in the group, who actively participated in their roleplay roles.

Not to be Missed. What a superb way to spend a couple of hours, take the audio tour if you get the chance, so very informative, so historic and so symbolic of British democracy. What an incredibly grand building. Not crowded with 20 minute intervals between tickets, don't miss it if you're in London and the tour is available.
Fascinating tour of a beautiful building. The Palace of Westminster is beautiful inside, so many detailed architectural features, paintings, statues etc - well worth a visit.
At the heart of ZBritish Democracy. This is an imposing building full of character inside and out. Extraordinary atrchitecture. It's a great place to bud it alongside Westminster Abbey and Thames.
Awesome!. The houses of parliament are a sight to see. make sure you see them from both sides from land and from river.
History. This place was awe inspiring the sheer size and architecture was beyond words we don't give it enough credit possibly

Great to see inside. Excellent walking audio tour of the House of Lords & Commons. Amazing to see the green and red benches that only normally see on TV. Security was tight (a really good thing), staff were friendly & helpful. The tour lasted about 1 1/2 hours & cost £18 each. Well worth a visit if you are interested in where our politicians go and the ornate interior is well worth seeing.

Great insight to history. Really interesting venue with the feel of Hogwarts great hall when you walk in. Steeped in history and a must do trip for any age even if you aren't interested in politics, it will draw you in to what's great about this nation and why we are a top tourist attraction for overseas visitors.

Free tour of Parliament. We booked a free tour of the Houses of Parliament through our MP. If you are not British, I believe you can pay for a tour at certain times. Regardless of whether you have to pay or not, it is absolutely worth your time as you get to see behind the scenes of such an iconic building. Our tour guide was entertaining and informative. He had loads of anecdotes and was open to questions from the visitors. It was quite thrilling to be able to follow the route the Queen takes during the State Opening of Parliament. Only downside is that photography is not permitted except in Westminster Hall. I would absolutely recommend a tour to anyone visiting London, especially those interested in history or politics.
Very informative. Worth arranging a visit. We did this through our local MP free of charge. So much to see behind the scenes. Tour lasted 90 minutes. Very interesting.

Stunning Architecture. I went on a tour of the Houses of Parliament with my brother who worked as an assistant to an MP on Parliament Hill back in Canada. It was very interesting to learn and see the differences between our governments (although most of it is very similar). Our guide was very informative. Architecturally the building is gorgeous and has so much history to it. It's a shame that photography is banned through most of the tour.
Nice. Its nearby to all the main London attractions like London eye, London dungeon, London sea life, shrek's adventure etc

Watch history live.. I've taken a guided tour in 2014 and it was great. This time we went to watch debates in both Parliament (House of Commons) & the House of Lords. This was much more fascinating than just the tour. Bonus - there is no charge for this. This can be done whenever Parliament is in session. They typically debate from 2 p.m. until 10 p.m. or so. If you have never seen politics in action, do go but don't expect exciting discourse just people making their points under Robert's Rules.
Really interesting. We took the audio guided tour which was really informative and interesting. This is well worth doing.
Amazing . You can tell it's such an amazing part of history and culture within the UK. It stands the test of time. Kids loved it too..

Such majestic, souring archicture. Another London icon.. The bus tour stops here so you can alight and walk around, see Ben Ben and Westminster Abbey as well. Could not stop taking photos of the towers, the whole building is enormous. Tours can be arranged though are not available to overseas visitors.
Better than expected. A good tour with excellent audio narrative. Security reassuring. Iconic place which every UK citizen should visit at least once.
An absolute must! . Whenever in London I always check out Charles Barry's masterpiece, full of pugin's beauties. The gothic building is a triumph of design.

Contact your MP. We had an amazing time visiting a truly fantastic monument to the history of Great Britain. The best way of seeing this amazing attraction is to contact your local MP and arrange a time to have a tour around the chambers.
Nice buildings. Nice to walk around as it was beautiful day, worth going around if times not an obstacle, easy to get to as tube leaves you right outside it

Must see inside. Excellent place to visit and it's free. Just turn up, wait in line and go through security. It is free to go into the commons or the house of lords. Visit the chamber whilst in session. Great experience when in London and totally free. Most people don't realise that.
Beautiful buildings. Fantastic visit here over the new year period, the buildings were beautiful and the audio guided tour was very informative.

Exceptional. Thanks to my work, we were able to get a inside tour. Impressive and exceptional is what comes to mind after finishing up. Historic in nature and fully stories and tales. Great opportunity if you get a chance and recommend you don't pass it up.

Ask, they'll maybe let you in. It's not obvious that the crowd of folks are guarding the entrance, but once accepted for one of the Houses, you are superbly conducted to the gallery. Don't expect to feel involved as the glass screens really divide you from the action.
London Iconic. One of London iconic, great place to take the pic from few different angle. Cross the bridge, you will see LondonEye as well ,if you have time, try to do day n night viewing

Worth a visit. We have been there three times to take friends and relatives from our country and we have enjoyed every single time. It is well worth a visit, but remember to book it in advance to avoid queuing!

Impressive area . Impressive buildings. There is so much to see. The area is huge and it is impressive to look at.
At least visit it with a hop off and on tour to see the huge place.

Worth the Queue. Airport style security check to access but definitely worth the hassle. We took the audio tour option and could spend as much time or as little as we wanted in the areas. Always good to spend time in the spaces where our politicians work to have a sense of how governments function.

Guided audio tour. We decided to go on the guided audio tour at 3pm on a Saturday. There was not a queue and we could go straight in. The audio tour was very informative and we managed to tour around with ease. Great to see inside the Houses of Lords and Commons. They look much smaller than they do on the TV. Would highly recommend this experience.

Stunning Architecture. I visited there some time ago for a charity event. I was stunned by how gorgeous the interior is. It's a shame that photography is banned. It's also a shame who occupies the Houses of Parliament, but we can't have everything...
Outstanding. A must for anyone interested in royalty and politics it's easy you just need to be in touch with your local mp

Love the Houses of Parliament . We had a guided tour of The Houses of Parliament and it was amazing so interesting and steeped in history. If your visiting London this is a must book online before you go as it gets booked up you won't regret it. Loved seeing inside this amazing building and learning about how it all works this should be on the school curriculum wish I'd have leant about it earlier. This is somewhere I wanted to go for so long and I'm so glad we finally did this. The tour was amazing and our guide was so smart answering all our questions.

Awesome. We went here and did a group tour, with a guide. This has to be the best way of viewing the Houses of Parliament as you get to some areas that are not normally available. Additionally the tour guide is so informative, they bring the building to life with the various stories and you get to ask questions. To walk in the footsteps of so many famous people, royalty, UK members of parliament and overseas visitors, the whole experience is awesome. The architecture, statues and pictures and the history related to them makes this a must place to visit. Visitors from overseas go here because of the history and how interesting the place is, if you are from the UK put this on your bucket list.
If you can go... GO!. This is part of our History. Westminster Hall is the only part of our original Palace of Westminster, but the whole place is staggering! It really is something we all should do.

Very interesting tour. We took the guided tour which was more expensive than the audio tour but it was well worth it. Our guide was really informative and she tailored the tour to the ages and different nationalities in the group. It took just over 90 minutes but went by very quickly! Would definitely recommend.

Blown away by the reality and grandeur of this building. What an amazing experience ! We selected the audio tour and it explains in detail each part of the building an it's workings. The beauty an grandeur of it is a true testament to its designers. After seeing the TV programmes of the lords and commons, there was something that brought it all to life during the tour. To go and sit in both houses was quite amazing.Always been fascinated by this building and it's architecture, a must for anyone with a curiosity about it and how the legislative process works in the UK
This Is London. On each and every visit to London we always go by the Houses Of Parliament. There is such history here and it is a beautiful area to photograph.
The architecture!. This place is beautiful. Got to sit in a couple of sessions in both Houses. The staff are very friendly.

Wonderful tour. Had a tour of The Houses of Parliament, provided by our local MP's secretary and she was good enough to give up her time to show us around.It was so unreal to be walking through the house of lords also seeing where the queen sits when making her speach. We then carried on through various areas before ending up in the house of commons, where the Prime Minister and MP's sit.Brilliant experience, but I think it is restricted to British Citizens
nice at night. seeing this world famous building lit up at night time made it seem more special than during the day

Eye opening!. I visited here because I was desperate to stand in the Great Hall, a place of huge historical significance. I didn't expect to enjoy the rest of the tour quite so much but it was fantastic.Be aware that there is airport style security on the way in so there may be delays and your bag will go through an xray machine. Pick up an audio guide! - I think it is one of the best I have ever used; informative and well paced. The children's version of the guide was fantastic too, my children couldn't wait to tell me what they had learnt!Allow 2 hours.

Great experience, great staff. My daughter and I did a tour of the Houses of Parliament. She had had a hip replacement three weeks before so her mobility on two crutches was restricted. We rand to book and were assured that there would be a wheelchair for her to use. In security, the staff made sure that she did not have to walk without her crutches by one of the stsff putting them through the X-Ray machine. The tour was great and was greatly enhanced by the staff doing their utmost to ensure that we had all the assistance we needed. After the tour, we had Afternoon Tea in a heated marquee, sitting beside the Thames, This was part of the package and was delightful with beautiful food and great staff! A wonderful experience for both of us!
British History at it's finest. The life and soul of British politics and modern day democracy will always be worth a visit, both for it's history and it's beauty.

For History/Architecture buffs or the plain curious. A nice area to walk and a short distance away from the London Eye. A very imposing cluster of buildings. We just saw it from the outside (no time for more unfortunately) but I want to revisit in the future. Also nice to take a boat/bus tour and see from afar (great photo opportunities).

Really interesting tour. Went for the guided tour and was really glad we did. We got to go to a few places you don't get to go with the audio tour. Our tour guide also had many interesting stories and really brought the place to life.
Wonderful place. Visited with friends. Such a wonderful place packed with history of our great country. House of commons and lords amazing
Pretty swell. Apparently some bloke tried to blow this place up once but I dunno why it looks bloody lovely to me, y'know?

Very Short tour. We arrived at parliament where we went through the usual checks. The guide met us in Westminster hall and showed us quickly around about 25-30 minutes later we arrived back at Westminster hall and told that the end, very short and not very descriptive. Afterwards we were meant to meet our MP (MP for Harlow and a cabinet member) in which he didn't even turn up. Altogether it was a waste of time.

Fascinating Experience. Not booked in as part of a tour group, we made use of the excellent audio facility. Access to most areas was allowed including the House of Lords and House of Commons. The audio tour was excellent and easy to follow and gave much insight and background. Older children will be interested and younger children won't find the length of time required too much of a burden. Allow about 90 mins or so, you won't be disappointed.

Interesting!. Speak to your local MP and see if you can get tickets for the debating chamber in the House of Commons. Organised tours are available, and the history of the place is amazing. The little church is beautiful, and Westminster Hall is breathtaking!
Must Visit. The guide was excellent.The historical synopsis very impressive. You just have to visit to appreciate the mother of all Parliaments.

Excellent. I attended with my Girl Guide group. We booked on the Votes for Women Family Tour which was a tour of the Houses of Commons and Lords looking particularly at the suffragette movement. The tour was an hour which was perfect for the girls and our Tour Guide Monica was fantastic, giving an animated insight into how the suffragettes sneaked into and caused disruption in the building. The grandeur of the Lords is breath taking and there were a few "wow"s coming from the girls. Would definitely visit again with my family.

Great tour, amazing experience.. We decided to be 'local tourists' after living in London for a few years and failing to visit many of the brilliant attractions/sites London has to offer.We bought our tickets online (I think there was a small discount) and arrived at the ticket office about 15 minutes before our tour. Ticket collection was pain free, and it was a short walk to the entrance of the tour route.The tour itself is very good value for money, with handheld electronic tours included in the price. The building itself is hard not to fall in love with, the varying architecture which has evolved over the years, and the sheer fact the building is steeped in history.There is something for everyone on this tour, although small children might not appreciate what they are experiencing.I would recommend to anyone who is a history buff, interested in architecture, politics. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour, which was excellent value for money.

Fact filled tour but afternoon tea disappointed. . My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the guided tour which was led by an enjoyably eccentric guide. Plenty of history to learn as we all went through both chambers and many other rooms. However the afternoon tea which we'd booked was one of the most disappointing I've ever had. The staff seemed more interested in tidying up and the food was only passable- not even up to the standard I've had in hotels. Possibly this was because we were the last seating of the day. My husband left hungry as the only food topped up was the scones, which weren't worst having more of.

Oh dear we had a fire drill.. We arrived here on time, to be given an airport style search, and 3 minutes before we were to be given a guided tour, we were asked to leave because of their once yearly fire drill. So we had to start all over again with a long queue of people and a search (airport style) all over again. We were meet by a chap who was our guide, and actually worked in the Houses of Parliament. He was a mine of information and made a brilliant guide, he was especially good with two young children, who were with their father, and made it interesting for them also, we found it a little on the chilly side, but we realy enjoyed it.

Beautiful to behold!. A beautiful building steeped in history. The structure is simply outstanding from the ornate carvings to the sheer size of it. Definitely worth a walk around. I believe there is also a tour possible but we visited on a Sunday when it was closed.It is worth saying that if you are visiting London get a London Pass and Oyster card we found them great value for money and the oyster card was a god send!
Amazing History - fantastic buildings. Well worth a visit - we went on a guided tour and all found it fascinating, our guide kept us all entertained with lots of stories/facts - amazing building.
Guided Tour a must. Can't believe how interesting this place was.High-level security on entering. Booking a must as very popular.The old great hall story we loved.
London is a beautiful city.. Very atmospheric, full of fascinating history and museums , lots to do for everyone , you really can not get bored here!!
Good Architecture. Good architecture and interesting if you are history/architecture lover. Can get good snaps, while wandering in central london
Great Experience. My father enjoyed a lot. It is very special for him among the places we visit. Very worth to travel with family.

Incredible history, take a guided tour. We visited the last Saturday in February 2016. Our tour guide was incredible, entertaining, and kept us amazed for the 90+ minutes of our tour. The place is amazing history and you see and walk into everything from the Queens cloakroom (used 15 minutes each year!) to both the House of Commons and Lords rooms. The ornamentation is out of this world. There is no way you can take it all in one tour. I highly recommend you show up for your time at least 15 minutes before your tour. Also, dress warmly as the place has little or no heat....which also helps you appreciate how the lawmakers feel daily.
Great. It's great to visit the heart of UK democracy. It's an amazing building inside and out, and the security is not particularly intrusive.
Impressive Building. A classic London landmark, it's very iconic. Make sure to check every angle properly, as is absolutely beautiful.It's usually very crowded, but it's worth it.

Don't Be Afraid To Jump On A Family Tour Even If You're Not A "Family". We jumped on the family suffragette tour last October which was cheaper and shorter than the standard tour - our guide was a little surprised as when they say "family" they mean "you know, for kids" but we were delighted not only with the content of the tour which was all linked to the suffragette movement, but also the tone of our guide, who kept everything fun and fascinating.The Houses of Parliament have so much history that it was nice to have all the stories connected by a theme and I'd highly recommend their family tours.
History before your eyes.. Fascinating to see how small the main debating chamber really is. Always looks bigger on TV. Informative guide.

day out with the reading crew. had a wonderful guided tour that lasted nearly 2hours by nigel hake. he made the visit very interesting and informative. we are so lucky to live not far from london with all the fabulous buildings that are all steep in history. the houses of parliament is the hub of the country and you get a real sense of importance going around, especially if you are fortunate to have a tour guide who knows is history. well worth a visit!

Home of British Democracy. Went on a tour arranged through my MP, these tours are free. Very interesting and informative, I did not realise how much I did not know about the Palace. I would have liked more time to look at things on the tour but one had to keep with the group so a lot is missed. One is not allowed to sit along the tour so if you cannot stand for ninety minutes whilst listening and moving through the rooms you must let someone at the Palace know before you attend.

Excellent tour. Booked the £25 guided tour of the Houses of Parliment during a recent visit to London. It lasted almost two hours, was most informative and nicely paced and suited adults and children alike. Lots of details on operations of parliment rather than dates and detail. Our guide, Lyn, made great efforts at including us all in the tour-children, foreigners and natives. Well worth the money. Jubilee cafe for visitors had a good choice of food and drink at inexpensive prices.

make the time to visit Parliament you will be happy you did. We had a great tour of the Parliament. The long and rich history and explanation of how things work in government today will stay with us. From Guy Fox trying to blow the place up to the trial of William Wallace to stories of Margret Thatcher or simply learning how a vote is cast in the House of Commons, this place is outstanding.
Iconic . Such an impressive part of Londons architecture.Well worth a visit.Photographs very well day or night.Love this area of London very much.

Wonderful Tour. We had a wonderful tour through the Houses of Parliament which I can highly recommend. Our Tour Guide was very informative about the history of the building and the running of the Houses which even though Australia is very similar to the British system it was great to here about the differences.It's a Tour well worth taking.

Quite an eye opener. Was quite blown away with this visit. Very well organised and parties are lined up in Westminster Hall initially which in itself is amazing due to the amount of historical events occurring here. Brilliant tour and well worth a visit. I'd recommend it to everyone.
Tour. Well worth going on this as so much history attached, saw both houses and PMQ's with some good questions and great put downs by PM Organise this via your MP and would highly reccomend visit.

Good insight. Had the privilege of visiting the Houses of Parliament whilst on a theatre visit to London. What a great insight into British politics. Was able to view a debate in the Commons chamber from the viewing gallery, walked through the historic Westminster Hall, etc.. Bought some interesting and unique gifts at reasonable cost from the gift shop and had a great scone, with cream and jam and a coffee in the cafe. All in all a very interesting experience. Very polite and attentive staff who were informative and helpful as well as maintaining security for all.
Majestic building. So much history in this important building. Be sure to get tours or even go in for a visit when the queen is out of town.

Fabulous building . My boss actually sits in the houses of parliament so to see it for myself was a great pleasure.The building is just breathtaking and the history is endless .The tour guide was excellent and very funny which I always enjoy rather than the drab tour guides you normally get.Great experience would recommend

Top place to visit. I was really impressed by this visit but make sure you get on a private guided tour 20 people .You have that personal interaction with a guide .Far better than I anticipated .Highlight of my visit to London

Both officialy and unofficialy.... I have been lucky enough to visit here both for launches, lunches and looking about. Get rid of the MP's and it would be the best visit in London. You can smell, touch and feel a 1000 years of history soaking into your very bones. Wether an Anglophile or not most of western history and style either sprung from here or walked through on the way to someplace else.
It is what it is. If you live architecture and a political nut then go visit, personally wasn't for me but an impressive building

A Memorable Day.. My wife and I recently celebrated our 70th birthdays. Although we've visited London hundreds of times as tourists we have never seen inside the Houses of Parliament. Through our local M.P. we arranged an official tour. You can also book a prepaid tour. The tour was in a group of about 20, led by an excellent guide with a great sense of humour. It takes about 90 minutes and, because of protocol in both houses, you are not able to sit down unless you are disabled or infirm. From the perspective of an Englishman with a fascination for British history, this was a memorable day. I learnt so much about British political history and the relationship between the two Houses of Parliament and the British monarchy stretching back a thousand years.
Magnificient architecture. Like in most capital's Houses of Parliament are centrally located with magnificient architecture. Also other attractions are in close vicinity.
Gabrielle, our tour guide. What a fascinating 2hours. Our guide was amazing keeping the interest of a 15,13,11 and 8 year old no mean challenge! A must for any visitor to London or Londoner!
An historical landmark . Well worth a trip to view parliament and Big Ben. Busy area with plenty to see. Great architecture and steeped in history.

Fabulous tour and service. Cannot praise the staff highly enough. We visited a few days before I had a spinal operation and so was in a wheelchair in a great deal of pain. The staff were so kind and helped us through the building at each stage. The visit was really interesting, a fascinating insight into government procedure and life and a great experience, and the cafe at the end was lovely too. Really enjoyed it.

A perfect jewel. Visited this grand palace of Westminster as a gift for Christmas, we booked for a guided tour & well worth the wait. The lady guide is very knowledgeable & we manage to see everything without feeling being rushed along like herd of sheep. Beautiful Architecture & they don't make them like this any more. I do hope they keep the renovation going, but I heard it will cost millions, but worth every pence.

Magnificent building and another must see . Instantly recognisable to millions, the building is quite stunning. Incredibly ornate architecture and plenty of history surrounding it of course. Looks wonderful close up or from the other side of the river.

Really Great Tour. Took the Audio tour Saturday 20th Feb 2016. I was sorry that when I booked all the escorted tours had gone. How wrong I was! The Audio tour was at your pace, you could clearly hear and you could spend as long as you liked in any part of the tour. I was concerned that the Audio Tour would not take you to the commons - it does. We stood in there for perhaps 20 minutes or more.First Class

Brilliant afternoon learning about the history of our country. Went with a group of mixed ages, everyone thoroughly enjoyed themselves and learnt a lot. The staff were excellent, especially when going through what could be stressful security. We did the audio tours which were good, would like to return and take a guide another time, or go and see a debate. Really inspired a lot of discussion about how the UK is run and how to be involved in that. Highly recommend.
Historical. As a lover of history it was amazing to see the roots of Canadian democracy here in London. I really enjoyed the architecture and had no issues visiting these historic buildings.

Quick, historic and enjoyable. Took a guided tour with my mom. Loved the tour. So much history to absorb. It was fun to be in the same room PM's questions happens or House of Commons/Lords meet. Loved it.

A must if possible. A group of us had a guided tour by our local MP Vernon Coaker's colleuge, everything from the brilliant statues of Winston Churchill & Margaret Thatcher in the lobby to the magnificent wooden carved ceiling in the old hall was absoluteley majestic truly well worth a visit
Very interesting visit. Took a guided tour which was very informative "Tim" our guide was very knowledgeable and entertaining. Would highly recommend this as a visit.

Guided tour. This was a fascinating visit. An amazing building. Well worth paying a little extra for the guided tour. The guide, Janet Smith I think, was very informative and was always willing to answer our questions.

A really great few hours. I booked this on line for myself and my 2 teenage children. It was superb. We did an audio tour and it felt like we had the place to ourselves. Very informative and the Houses of Commons and Lords were packed with history and stunning to see. Excellent value for money and a really worthwhile visit. We spent about 3 hours there which was perfect.

Do the guided tour. My wife and I did the Parliment guided tour and enjoyed every minute of it. What a great history in these rooms have. The guide was very knowledgable and the guided tour takes you "behind the ropes" to see more than the audio tour.

Guided tour of the Houses of Parliament. The House of Lords part of the tour was simply impressive.Each room was exquisitely decorated with rich reds, dark greens and golds. Stunning wood panels and paintings that reflected important Bristish history to the Victorians.The House of Commons was simple in comparison to the Lords but well worth seeing.Our guide, Lynsey, was informative, clear and engaging. She gave enough information to sustain interest for an hour and a half, showing a non partisan viewpoint in each room.We highly recommend this tour.Do book in advance.
Heart of UK democracy. Audio guide included. Lots of history! Worth a visit. The little cafe is very nice. No photo is most areas.

History lovers dream. Really enjoyed going in the tour. Great way to soak up some history and see things I didn't even realise we're part of Britain's history. Tours were leaving every 5 mins and the tour size was just right. Worth knowing that there is a shop just near the tube that sells the same as the one on the tour so you can avoid queuing.

Iconic. The image everyone recognises as " London" Closest tube Westminister , gets very packed and snarled with people taking pics.Prob best to cross over the bridge to the side opposite to the tube station , seems to be less people. Would be worth walking along the South bank by the Eye to beget and view and also walking past St Thomas's Hospital directly opposite the Houses of Parliament and walking alongside the River to take in the view
Audio tour is worthwhile and well done. The audio tour is worthwhile and well done, You can choose to "speed' through or go at a more leisurely pace and listen to all the explanations.

Impressive. We visited with our daughter and son in law and three grandchildren who really enjoyed our walk around London visiting famous places. It was a glorious day weather wise and enjoyed by all.

Pretty awesome . I was in London on a business trip and walked over. The architecture was pretty cool. But the real thing is thinking of all the western history that was debated and decided in this location. It's a pretty amazing thing. Big Ben hovering over it all.

A must for everyone - even teenagers!. I have never visited the houses of parliament and determined to do so! Our teenagers told us they were not interested in doing but would do so if we really wanted to, which we did and yes they were engrossed so I would suggest dragging any teenager in. It is a slice of life for as we have seen it on the TV so often and I have to say made me feel proud to be british! We had the audio tour and this allowed free entry for the children so though it was excellent value and would like to see it when they are working. Really pleased we went and would recommend that everyone goes at some point.

An outstanding facility. Once you have got through security which is very tight. Be prepared to feel you have been here before, because you have of course in æ way. Hogwarts meets Victorian and medieval Westminster Hall.

Family visit. Really enjoyed this visit with my husband and our granddaughter aged 9. Chose an audio guide as thought it might be best with a young one in tow; turned out to be a good decision as she had lots of comments and questions. Children's audio guide available and this kept her intrigued all round. Lasted about an hour and a half. Good value as children are free although you still need to book them a ticket. Airport search on entry but we didn't queue nor wait very long. Really helpful guides; happy to answer and patient with young one. Shame the photo opportunities are limited but understandable. Nice coffee shop for afterwards and a reasonably priced gift shop for granddaughter.
tour excellent and Hilary was wonderful. thoroughly enjoyed the tour and the history,Hilary our guide made it fun and she was funny regarding tour giude who was not officIAL!

Excellent look at history. Not the cheapest way of doing a tour I'm sure, but you get the audio guide and there are additional guides in every room to answer questions. With the audio guide however, you are able to move at your own pace. I'm really pleased we made this tour as it was not as busy as I had expected, very informative and a great eye opener into our history.

A Must See!. We were lucky to get a private tour, however, the organised tours were having an amazing time too.
